Study_Level.title: Modulation Strategies for Robust Optical Wireless Communications and Sensing in 6G
Study_Level.authors: Bruno M.S.R. Rosmaninho, Paulo P. Monteiro, Vinicius. N.H. Silva, Maria C.R. Medeiros
Study_Level.scenario_description: VLC system using CE-OFDM for communication and localization
Study_Level.key_contribution: CE-OFDM is a promising waveform for VLC systems in 6G, offering advantages in both communication robustness and potential for localization.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the need for a waveform that can support both communication and localization in VLC systems.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a thorough analysis of the CE-OFDM waveform for VLC systems, including its performance in terms of EVM and BER.

Study_Level.title: Photonic Terahertz Integrated Sensing and Communication (ISAC) Systems
Study_Level.authors: Lu Zhang, Zhidong Lyu, Oskars Ozolins, Xiaodan Pang, Xianbin Yu
Study_Level.scenario_description: Photonic terahertz integrated sensing and communication systems
Study_Level.key_contribution: The paper presents advancements in photonic THz-ISAC systems, emphasizing integrated waveform design, coherent fusion processing, and communication enhancements through sensing.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the need for new waveform and system design research that optimally aligns time and frequency resources to enhance ISAC system performance.

Experiments.scenario_label: Photonic THz-ISAC system with LFM-PSK waveform

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a comprehensive overview of photonic THz-ISAC systems, with a focus on integrated waveform design and coherent fusion processing.

Study_Level.title: Analysis of Visible Light-Based ISAC Channel Characteristics in a V2V Scenario
Study_Level.authors: Peiyao Dong, Pan Tang, Yue Yin, Lei Tian, Jianhua Zhang
Study_Level.venue: 2025 IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference (WCNC)
Study_Level.scenario_description: Vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) scenario using visible light-based ISAC
Study_Level.key_contribution: Investigation of visible light-based ISAC channel characteristics in a V2V scenario
Study_Level.gap_addressed: Limited research on sensing channel in outdoor visible light communication

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: Simulation-based study with limited experimental validation

Study_Level.title: Adiabatic-tapered few-mode-fiber-based system for integrating optical fiber sensing and telecommunication
Study_Level.authors: Quandong Huang, Yahao Li, Ou Xu, Xinyong Dong, Sławomir Ertman, Tomasz R. Woliński, Perry Ping Shum, Yuwen Qin
Study_Level.scenario_description: Integration of optical fiber sensing and telecommunication in a long-haul FMF
Study_Level.key_contribution: Demonstration of an adiabatic-tapered few-mode-fiber-based system for integrating sensing and telecommunication
Study_Level.gap_addressed: Integration of optical fiber sensing and telecommunication in a long-haul FMF

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a well-designed experiment with clear results, but lacks some details on the modelling and validation.

Study_Level.title: Integrated Sensing and Communication for UAV Trajectory Optimization in Mixed FSO-RF Networks in Dynamic Weather Conditions
Study_Level.authors: Muhammad Nafees, Mohammadamin Baniasadi, James R. Hopgood, Majid Safari and John S. Thompson
Study_Level.scenario_description: UAV-aided mixed FSO-RF network for edge-user capacity enhancement in dynamic weather conditions
Study_Level.key_contribution: A novel O-ISAC framework is proposed to optimize UAV trajectory in mixed FSO-RF networks, leveraging backscattered light for FSO channel sensing and dynamic adjustment of UAV parameters.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed framework addresses the challenge of optimizing UAV trajectory in dynamic weather conditions to maximize edge-user capacity.

Experiments.scenario_label: Outdoor FSO, 1 km visibility, SNR threshold 10 dB

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper proposes a novel O-ISAC framework and evaluates its performance using simulations.

Study_Level.title: Recent Advancements and Challenges in Integrated Sensing and Communication in Optical Fiber
Study_Level.authors: Ying Wu, Chao Xu, Fang Chen, Ying Wang, Guangzhe Wu, Peizhe Xin, Zhiyi Chen, Peng Zhan, Zhirui Zhou, Zuoxing Zhang, Weizhe Ma, Meng Li, Jing Yan, Mengwen Pa, Yajie Li, Yongli Zhao, Jie Zhang
Study_Level.scenario_description: The paper discusses the current development status of integrated sensing and communication in optical fiber, presenting several of the latest solutions and analyzing their differences, advantages, and disadvantages.
Study_Level.key_contribution: The paper provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of integrated sensing and communication in optical fiber, highlighting the advantages and challenges of different approaches.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the gap in the current literature by providing a detailed analysis of the differences, advantages, and disadvantages of various integrated sensing and communication solutions in optical fiber.

Experiments.scenario_label: Forward transmitted light, C+L wavelength division multiplexing (WDM) transmission system
Backscattered light, phase-sensitive optical time domain reflectometer (φ-OTDR)

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of integrated sensing and communication in optical fiber, but lacks detailed experimental results and uncertainty analysis.

Study_Level.title: Miniaturized optical fiber displacement probe with large-collection-angle
Study_Level.authors: Chengpin Wu, Xikai Hou, Jiaqi Zhu, Leiming Wu
Study_Level.scenario_description: Precision measurement of R angles and small rough spots in narrow spaces
Study_Level.key_contribution: A fiber optic displacement sensing probe with a common optical path Michelson interferometer structure
Study_Level.gap_addressed: High precision measurement of R angles and small rough spots in narrow spaces

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper lacks experimental validation and does not report communication metrics

Study_Level.title: Wide-steering Integrated Sensing and Communication OPA-based Lidar Design with Joint Waveform and Thinned Antenna
Study_Level.authors: Yang Chen, Xianqiao Liao, Jian Xiao, Xiaochuan Wang, Mengyuan Ye, Yu Yu, Chao Wang
Study_Level.scenario_description: An integrated sensing and communication Lidar system with joint waveform and thinned ring antenna array
Study_Level.key_contribution: A QPSK-FMCW joint waveform design is proposed to implement simultaneous Lidar sensing and data communication.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed system achieves a higher data rate of 4Gbps and a wider steering range of 60°×32°.

Experiments.scenario_label: Indoor OPA-based Lidar with QPSK-FMCW joint waveform

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper lacks experimental validation and does not report both sensing and communication metrics.

Study_Level.title: Integrated Positioning and Communication Relying on Wireless Optical OFDM
Study_Level.authors: Chao Xu, Christos Masouros, Shinya Sugiura, Periklis Petropoulos, Robert G. Maunder, Lie-Liang Yang, Harald Haas, Lajos Hanzo
Study_Level.venue: IEEE Journal on Selected Areas in Communications
Study_Level.scenario_description: The system consists of LEDs and photodiodes (PDs) in an indoor environment, where the LEDs transmit data to the PDs using visible light communication (VLC). The system uses OFDM radar sensing to estimate the distance between the LEDs and PDs.
Study_Level.key_contribution: The paper proposes a new VLPC scheme using DCO-OFDM, where OFDM radar is applied for improving the resolution of the estimated Channel Impulse Response (CIRs) exploited for positioning functionality.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the challenge of achieving high-resolution sensing and high-rate communication in the optical band.

Experiments.scenario_label: Indoor VLC with OFDM Radar Sensing

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper provides a detailed analysis of the system performance, including the effects of OFDM radar sensing on the positioning accuracy and communication data rate.

Study_Level.title: High-speed DMT signal and power-over-fiber simultaneous transmission over weakly-coupled multicore Fiber
Study_Level.authors: Wei Chen, Jianping Li, Songnian Fu, Xinkuo Yu, Yuwen Qin, Jianbo Zhang
Study_Level.scenario_description: High-speed DMT signal and power-over-fiber simultaneous transmission over weakly-coupled multicore fiber for Digital Grid application scenarios
Study_Level.key_contribution: Experimental demonstration of simultaneous transmission of 60 W power-over-fiber signal with 117 Gbit/s and 140 Gbit/s high-speed DMT signal in an IM-DD system over 1 km 7-core multicore fiber
Study_Level.gap_addressed: High-speed and high-power transmission needs for Digital Grid application scenarios

Experiments.scenario_label: 1 km 7-core multicore fiber, 60 W power-over-fiber, 117 Gbit/s and 140 Gbit/s DMT signal

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper reports experimental results for simultaneous transmission of high-speed DMT signal and power-over-fiber signal over 1 km 7-core multicore fiber, but lacks detailed information on the experimental setup and measurement procedures.

Study_Level.title: Retroreflective Optical ISAC Supporting 3D Positioning in Indoor Environments
Study_Level.authors: Haochuan Wang, Binbin Zhu, Zhihong Zeng, Sihua Shao, Chen Chen, Min Liu
Study_Level.scenario_description: A retroreflective optical ISAC system supporting 3D positioning in indoor environments
Study_Level.key_contribution: A retroreflective optical ISAC system supporting 3D positioning in indoor environments is proposed
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The system achieves the combination of high-speed communication and positioning functions by adding a small amount of complexity

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper proposes a retroreflective optical ISAC system supporting 3D positioning in indoor environments, but the evaluation is based on simulation results only

Study_Level.title: Phase-Coded FMCW for Optical Integrated Sensing and Communication
Study_Level.authors: Tianzhu Zhang, Zhongji Yan, Anning Pang, Anhong Dang
Study_Level.scenario_description: Optical integrated sensing and communication using phase-coded frequency-modulated continuous wave (PC-FMCW)
Study_Level.key_contribution: A phase-coded FMCW scheme for optical sensing and communication is proposed and simulated.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed scheme achieves the integration of optical sensing and communication without mutual interference.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: Simulation results are reported, but no experimental validation is provided.

Study_Level.title: Single-Ended > 100-km Distributed Vibration Sensor Based on OFDR Using Pearson Correlation Coefficient
Study_Level.authors: Haohan Guo, Kun Liu, Yuanyao Li, Ji Liu, Huafang Wang, Jinqi Deng, Junfeng Jiang, Tiegen Liu, and Zhenyang Ding
Study_Level.scenario_description: Distributed vibration sensing in a lab environment using a single-ended OFDR system
Study_Level.key_contribution: A simple and effective method for demodulating vibration events using the Pearson correlation coefficient in a single-ended OFDR system
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The need for a simple and effective method for demodulating vibration events in a single-ended OFDR system

Experiments.scenario_label: Single-ended OFDR system with a 100.9 km fiber

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a simple and effective method for demodulating vibration events using the Pearson correlation coefficient in a single-ended OFDR system. However, the paper lacks a thorough analysis of the tradeoff between the sensing range and the spatial resolution.

Study_Level.title: Experimental Demonstration of Power over Fiber for Power Grid Application
Study_Level.authors: Zemian Zeng, Changna Chen, Xiaosheng Lin, Wei Chen, Jianping Li, Yuwen Qin
Study_Level.scenario_description: Power over fiber system for power grid application
Study_Level.key_contribution: Experimental demonstration of power over fiber system for power grid application
Study_Level.gap_addressed: Power grid application using power over fiber technology

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: Experimental demonstration of power over fiber system for power grid application

Study_Level.title: Movable Access Point-Aided Integrated Visible Light Communication and Sensing Networks
Study_Level.authors: Zohaib Saghir, Sylvester Aboagye
Study_Level.scenario_description: A movable access point-aided integrated visible light communication and sensing system in an indoor environment
Study_Level.key_contribution: A novel system model for integrated visible light communication and sensing that integrates movable access point technology to address line-of-sight blockage, device orientation, and user mobility issues
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed system model and algorithm aim to overcome the limitations of traditional fixed access point systems in indoor visible light communication and sensing

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a simulation-based study with a clear description of the system model and algorithm. However, the modelling fidelity is high, but the validation strength, experimental validity, and metric completeness are limited.

Study_Level.title: Demonstration of Photonic Sub-THz ISAC System with Real-Time 251.03-Gbps Communication Rate and Offline 2.5-cm Sensing Resolution
Study_Level.authors: Mingzheng Lei, Zhidong Lyu, Qingzhi Zhou, Junhao Zhang, Hao Li, Bingchang Hua, Jiao Zhang, Yuancheng Cai, Junjie Ding, Xingyu Chen, Lu Zhang, Jianjun Yu, Min Zhu
Study_Level.scenario_description: A photonic sub-THz ISAC system for real-time communication and offline sensing
Study_Level.key_contribution: A photonic sub-THz ISAC system with 251.03-Gbps real-time communication rate and 2.5-cm offline sensing resolution
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The need for ultra-high-speed communication and ultra-resolution sensing in 6G networks

Experiments.scenario_label: Sub-THz ISAC system with 10.3m wireless distance

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a photonic sub-THz ISAC system with real-time communication and offline sensing capabilities.

Study_Level.title: Double-effect DNN-based DBP Scheme for Integrated Sensing and Communications (ISAC)
Study_Level.authors: Feiyu Li, Xian Zhou, Qirui Fan, Yuyuan Gao, Jiahao Huo, Jinhui Yuan, Keping Long
Study_Level.scenario_description: A 28-GBaud 16-QAM coherent optical system is built over a 15×80 km SSMF transmission link
Study_Level.key_contribution: A double-effect DNN-based DBP scheme is proposed to integrate communication and sensing, which can mitigate nonlinear interference effectively and estimate optical power distribution accurately
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed scheme addresses the challenge of integrating sensing and communication in optical fiber systems

Experiments.scenario_label: 28-GBaud 16-QAM coherent optical system over 15×80 km SSMF transmission link

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper proposes a double-effect DNN-based DBP scheme for ISAC, but lacks experimental validation and complete metric reporting

Study_Level.title: Coexistence of Distributed Sensing and Ultra-Simple Coherent RoF Based Front-Haul for Radio Access Network
Study_Level.authors: Maoqi Liu, Jingchuan Wang, Chen Liu, Changyuan Yu, Chao Lu
Study_Level.scenario_description: Distributed sensing and ultra-simple coherent RoF based front-haul for radio access network
Study_Level.key_contribution: An ultra-simple RoF system that achieves the coexistence of distributed sensing and telecommunication
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The coexistence of distributed sensing and telecommunication in radio access networks

Experiments.scenario_label: 10km fiber link and 1m wireless MMW channel

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a comprehensive study on the coexistence of distributed sensing and ultra-simple coherent RoF based front-haul for radio access networks

Study_Level.title: Full-duplex Integrated Sensing and Communication System Based on Microwave Photonics
Study_Level.authors: Weiqiong Wang, Guanxing Zhang, He Wen, Jie Zhang
Study_Level.scenario_description: A full-duplex integrated sensing and communication system based on microwave photonics technology is proposed.
Study_Level.key_contribution: A novel ISAC system based on microwave photonics to offer wide bandwidth, supporting full-duplex ISAC.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The system supports full-duplex ISAC, where phase modulation is used for the downlink and intensity modulation for the uplink.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a novel ISAC system based on microwave photonics, with a clear description of the system architecture and experimental setup.

Study_Level.title: Photonic Integrated Sensing and Communication System Harnessing Submarine Fiber Optic Cables for Coastal Event Monitoring
Study_Level.authors: Shaoyi Chen, Kun Zhu, Jun Han, Qi Sui, and Zhaohui Li
Study_Level.scenario_description: Coastal event monitoring using submarine fiber optic cables
Study_Level.key_contribution: A photonic integrated sensing and communication system for coastal event monitoring using submarine fiber optic cables
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The need for a low-cost, versatile, and environmentally friendly method for monitoring coastal events

Experiments.scenario_label: Ocean wave analysis using photonic ISAC with submarine telecommunication fiber
Earthquake detection using photonic ISAC with submarine telecommunication fiber
Ferry monitoring using photonic ISAC with submarine telecommunication fiber

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a photonic integrated sensing and communication system for coastal event monitoring using submarine fiber optic cables. The system is experimentally demonstrated for ocean wave analysis, earthquake detection, and ferry monitoring.

Study_Level.title: Optical Integrated Sensing and Communication: Architectures, Potentials and Challenges
Study_Level.authors: Yunfeng Wen, Fang Yang, Jian Song, and Zhu Han
Study_Level.scenario_description: Free-space optical integrated sensing and communication system for various applications
Study_Level.key_contribution: The paper introduces the concept of optical integrated sensing and communication (O-ISAC) and discusses its potential applications and challenges.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the gap in the existing literature by providing a comprehensive overview of O-ISAC and its potential applications.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper provides a comprehensive overview of O-ISAC and its potential applications, but lacks experimental validation and reproducibility.

Study_Level.title: Joint Visible Light Sensing and Communication Using m-CAP Modulation
Study_Level.authors: Lina Shi, Bastien Béchadergue, Luc Chassagne, Hongyu Guan
Study_Level.scenario_description: A joint visible light communication and sensing system using m-CAP modulation and RSS-based trilateration in an indoor environment.
Study_Level.key_contribution: A joint visible light communication and sensing system using m-CAP modulation and RSS-based trilateration.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The system addresses the need for joint communication and sensing in indoor environments.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a simulation-based study with a clear description of the system and its parameters.

Study_Level.title: Free-Space Optical Integrated Sensing and Communication Based on DCO-OFDM: Performance Metrics and Resource Allocation
Study_Level.authors: Yunfeng Wen, Fang Yang, Jian Song, Zhu Han
Study_Level.scenario_description: Free-space optical integrated sensing and communication system using DCO-OFDM
Study_Level.key_contribution: The paper proposes a DCO-OFDM scheme for FSO-ISAC and derives performance metrics for communication and sensing.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The paper addresses the gap in the literature by providing a comprehensive analysis of optical OFDM schemes in FSO-ISAC.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper provides a comprehensive analysis of optical OFDM schemes in FSO-ISAC and derives performance metrics for communication and sensing.

Study_Level.title: Pre-compensation of LFM Sensing Probe via Integrated Sensing and Communication over Fiber System
Study_Level.authors: LIU Maoqi, WANG Jingchuan, LIU Chen, YU Changyuan, LU Chao

Study_Level.key_contribution: A novel framework for pre-compensation of LFM sensing probe via integrated sensing and communication over fiber system
Study_Level.gap_addressed: Improving sensing signal-to-noise ratio by 2.4 dB

Experiments.scenario_label: 40-km fiber link with 1 m spatial resolution

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper reports a novel framework for pre-compensation of LFM sensing probe via integrated sensing and communication over fiber system, but lacks detailed modelling and validation.

Study_Level.title: Optical Transport Network Optimization Supporting Integrated Sensing and Communication Services
Study_Level.authors: Markos Anastasopoulos, Jesús Gutiérrez, Anna Tzanakaki
Study_Level.scenario_description: Optical transport network supporting ISAC services using 3GPP compliant RF signals
Study_Level.key_contribution: Experimental validation of an architecture exploiting an optical transport network to facilitate joint support of sensing and communication services
Study_Level.gap_addressed: Optimization of optical transport network operation for ISAC services

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: Experimental validation of the proposed architecture

Study_Level.title: W-band Photonic-based Integration of Sensing and Communication with Frequency-division Multiplexed Waveforms in Fiber-wireless Integrated Network
Study_Level.authors: Boyu Dong, Guoqiang Li, HaiPeng Wang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Junwen Zhang, Nan Chi
Study_Level.scenario_description: A W-band photonic-based ISAC system with an integrated waveform consisting of subcarrier modulated (SCM) and linear frequency modulated (LFM) signals for a fiber-wireless integrated network.
Study_Level.key_contribution: A photonic-based MMW fiber-wireless ISAC system at W-band with an integrated waveform is proposed and experimentally demonstrated.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The proposed system achieves high-speed communication and high-resolution sensing simultaneously.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper reports a photonic-based MMW fiber-wireless ISAC system with an integrated waveform, but lacks detailed information on the system's modeling fidelity, validation strength, and experimental validity.

Study_Level.title: Low Crosstalk Deep Ocean Salinity Monitoring at 2 µm Wavelength Band
Study_Level.authors: Yahao Li, Quandong Huan, Chaoyue Wang, Yu Huang, Wanyu Wu, Jiaqi Ran, Yanping Li, Jun Xue, Sławomir Ertman, Chenxu Lu, Ou Xu, Xinyong Dong, Tomasz R. Wolinski, Perry Ping Shum
Study_Level.scenario_description: Ocean salinity monitoring
Study_Level.key_contribution: An all-optical fiber seawater salinity sensor with high sensitivity and low crosstalk from ambient pressure and temperature variations.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The need for a simple, low-cost, and high-stability sensor for ocean salinity monitoring.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper lacks completeness in reporting both communication and sensing metrics.

Study_Level.title: Performance Improvement for Symmetric Carrier-assisted Differential Detection Receiver by Pairwise Coding
Study_Level.authors: Zihua Huang, Jianping Li, Xinkuo Yu, Jianqing He, Yuwen Qin, Meng Xiang, and Songnian Fu
Study_Level.scenario_description: Short-reach optical communication systems for data center interconnection
Study_Level.key_contribution: The authors propose a pairwise coding (PWC) scheme to improve the sensitivity of symmetric carrier-assisted differential detection (S-CADD) receivers.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The authors address the color SNR effect caused by the intrinsic transfer function of S-CADD receivers.

Experiments.scenario_label: 64 Gbaud 16-QAM OFDM signal transmission over 80km SSMF

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a simulation-based study with a clear description of the system model and parameters.

Study_Level.title: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network

Study_Level.venue: IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques
Study_Level.scenario_description: A D-band photonic-based ISAC system for fiber-wireless networks with full-photonic direct LFM reception and de-chirping
Study_Level.key_contribution: A novel D-band photonic-based ISAC system with full-photonic direct LFM reception and de-chirping for fiber-wireless networks
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbps

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a comprehensive evaluation of the proposed system, including experimental results and theoretical analysis.

Study_Level.key_contribution: ReflexGest is a novel ISAC design of HGR system, piggybacking onto VLC-capable table lamps.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: ReflexGest addresses the challenge of recognizing hand gestures under the reflection interference caused by the table surface.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper presents a thorough evaluation of the proposed system, including experiments and simulations.

Study_Level.title: Power Allocation for OFDM-Based Free Space Optical Integrated Sensing and Communication
Study_Level.authors: Yunfeng Wen, Fang Yang, Jian Song, Zhu Han
Study_Level.scenario_description: Free space optical integrated sensing and communication system using OFDM
Study_Level.key_contribution: The authors propose a DCO-OFDM scheme for FSO-ISAC and study the optimal power allocation in the communication-centric scenario.
Study_Level.gap_addressed: The authors address the gap in the literature by proposing a novel power allocation strategy for OFDM-based FSO-ISAC systems.

Quality_Assessment.tqaf_notes: The paper provides a detailed analysis of the proposed DCO-OFDM scheme for FSO-ISAC, including the derivation of the communication and sensing performance metrics and the optimization of the power allocation strategy.

Study_Level.title: A Unified Waveform for Optical Wireless Integrated Sensing and Communication
